[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Overall] [UTXO Set Consistency - High] When retrieving transactions, can spent vs unspent UTXO state inconsistencies cause double-spend vulnerabilities?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: new()] [String Parsing Attack - Medium] The method name extraction uses split(' ').next().unwrap_or('')—can malformed help output with no spaces cause unexpected behavior?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: new()] [Early Break Logic - Low] The early break when expected_methods.is_empty() at line 92-94—can this skip validation of remaining help text that might indicate node issues?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: new()] [Set Mutation Race - Low] Is the HashSet mutation during iteration thread-safe, or can concurrent access cause issues?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [JSON-RPC Version - Low] The request hardcodes jsonrpc: '2.0'—can version mismatches with the Bitcoin node cause subtle response parsing issues?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Missing Request ID - Medium] Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC typically requires an id field for request tracking—is the absence of id in the request potentially problematic?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Batch Requests - Low] Does the client support JSON-RPC batch requests for efficiency, or could batching introduce atomicity issues?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Struct: Rpc] [URL Validation - Medium] Is there validation that the provided URL is well-formed and uses expected protocols (http/https)?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Struct: Rpc] [DNS Rebinding - Medium] Can DNS rebinding attacks redirect RPC calls to malicious endpoints after initial validation?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Struct: Rpc] [localhost Bypass - Low] If url points to localhost, can local privilege escalation allow other processes to impersonate the Bitcoin node?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Encoding Ambiguity - High] The verbosity parameter 0 returns hex—can different encoding interpretations cause consensus divergence between validators?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: send_raw_transaction()] [Hex Encoding Case - Low] Does encode::serialize_hex produce lowercase/uppercase consistently? Can case sensitivity cause issues?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Multiple Functions] [UTF-8 Validation - Low] Are all string responses properly validated as UTF-8 before processing?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Merkle Root Validation - High] Does the retrieved block have its merkle root validated against included transactions to prevent merkle tree attacks?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Block Header Validation - High] Are block header fields (version, timestamp, difficulty, nonce) validated against Bitcoin consensus rules?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_transaction()] [Transaction Validation - High] Does transaction retrieval validate scripts, signatures, and consensus rules, or just deserialize structure?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_latest_block_number()] [Genesis Block - Low] Is the genesis block (height 0) handled correctly in all code paths that process block numbers?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block_hash()] [Maximum Block Height - Low] Can requesting block heights far in the future (beyond current chain tip) cause errors or undefined behavior?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: send_raw_transaction()] [Empty Transaction - Low] Can a transaction with no inputs or outputs be broadcast, potentially causing issues in processing logic?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_transaction()] [Coinbase Transaction - Medium] Are coinbase transactions (which have no inputs) handled correctly in all processing paths?
[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Credential Storage - Medium] Where are basic auth credentials stored in memory, and can they leak through error messages or logs?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: rpc_call()] [Auth Timing Attack - Low] Does the authentication mechanism have constant-time comparison to prevent timing-based credential extraction?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Permission Model - Medium] Does the Bitcoin RPC user have minimum required permissions, or can excessive permissions increase attack surface?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Response Integrity - Critical] Without cryptographic verification beyond hash comparison, can a MITM attacker substitute blocks that pass hash validation?

[File: serai/networks/bitcoin/src/rpc.rs] [Function: get_transaction()] [Transaction Authenticity - High] Can a compromised network path return valid but incorrect transactions that match the requested hash?
